TF021070-SWEDISH (SIDA) CONSULTANTS
            TRUST FUND,TF034122-CHILE - MUNICIPAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF031546-CHILE - MUNICIPAL DEVELOPMENT,TF031192-CHILE - URBAN,TF020400-NETHERLANDS' CONSULTANTS

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall assessment of the project is
            satisfactory. The project objectives were met, and, improved
            management practices were successfully promoted among
            participating municipalities. Additionally, the project
            successfully served as an interface, promoting structured
            consultations between municipal and national authorities, on
            policy issues regarding the decentralization process. The
            key lessons show that: 1) pilot municipal projects can be
            effective tools in helping define a decentralization
            strategy, since the close dialogue between municipalities
            and the national government, may strengthen democracy,
            developing sustainable democratic institutions; 2) even
            though technical assistance projects may achieve
            considerable fiscal improvements in individual
            municipalities, it will not substitute for the adequacy of
            policy incentives, built into the overall transfer system
            and legislation, and induce a full scale reform; 3)
            municipalities have the responsibility to project
            effectiveness, to be willing to pursue the necessary
            reforms, and to be involved in every stage, to showcase
            progress; 4) the involvement of key municipal staff is a
            strong determinant of reform, for it is their knowledge of
            the day-to-day operation, that translates into a sustained
            long-run efficiency; 5) adequate supervision is paramount,
            to develop a first-hand knowledge of the progress of the project.
